description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Business Systems Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage various Engineering-specific programs and teams.

As a Business Systems Manager, you'll deliver systems, tools, data and education to support Google Data Center (GDC) business processes. You'll also manage a growing team of Technical Delivery managers across the software development lifecycle, partnering with business stakeholders in Design, Construction and Operations in support of Google’s Data Center team.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of industry experience in one or more of the following fields: Master Data Management, Information Management, System Administration, Corporate IT.
  • 10 years of experience managing a technical team of program managers and/or engineers responsible for critical systems and operations for a distributed organization.
  • Experience in defining and managing all phases of an IT roadmap.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Technical, hands-on experience in system administration or IT operations.
  • Ability to adjust to rapidly changing business requirements and make decisions with limited information.
  • Ability to build and staff new IT service areas and teams, working with global and cross-functional internal and external teams.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage across multiple, often time-sensitive initiatives.
  • Exceptional organizational, communication, leadership, and customer service skills.
responsibilities:
• Develop business requirements, implementation plans and the entire product management lifecycle, to accelerate the delivery of data centers and optimize operations.
  • Provide the long-term strategy and roadmap to support the GDC business to scale with information by driving the software development lifecycle.
  • Provide software tools leadership for large, complex, cross-functional program teams within our Google Data Center organization.
  • Plan and execute all IT development activities and ensure transition from construction into operations.
  • Define near-term and long-term strategy to support information management needs across the Data Center lifecycle, including master data management. Drive results by tracking key operational metrics, identifying process improvement opportunities and delivering on strategic initiatives.
title: Business Systems Manager
